narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Some knowledge about ballet's history and current state.
I learned so much about American ballet history and also basic dance vocabulary. Taking this class is like getting a thoughtful glimpse into the dance world.
I learned a lit about the current state of ballet and basic ballet movements.
a really unique view of the ballet word today from industry leaders

I gained a deeper understanding of the history of ballet and the ways in which ballet has adapted to the current social climate. This was extremely insightful, especially given the ways ballet has been forced to adapt because of COVID.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
1. The strength of this class is that its very different from other courses at Yale. It was fun to dance and learn about something not as academic. 

2. The main weakness of this course is that while the professor is well meaning, he had no idea how to structure a class. I do not blame him, I blame Yale you cannot just give an expert on a topic free reign to format a seminar however he wants if he has no idea what a seminar should look like. I enjoyed the class but the structure had many flaws. I will list some of the issues below. 
- This was a seminar, and no one ever talked. Basically, he read a few sentences from our reading responses aloud at the beginning of class for about 5 minutes then he had us dance but we didn't receive much instruction on that either we basically just followed him. Then he would introduce that weeks speaker and would basically talk to them for an hour while we sat there and didn't say a word. In the last few classes we were able to ask them one question but I am pretty sure the whole point of a Yale seminar is for the students to talk and interact with the professor and the other students. I don't think one person ever spoke directly to another student. Again, I don't blame him, if the university is going to hire a professional ballet dancer to teach a seminar they have to give him some guidelines. At least tell him that the students should talk to each other. 
- Never received a single ounce of written feedback or grades even on our midterm
- The assignments were very vague and gave no examples of what he'd actually like to see
- When our assignments were due, as well as their requirements were assigned very close to when they were due and gave us very little ability to plan ahead.
Professor Ulbricht is warm, kind, and encouraging! He creates an inclusive environment in which learning is fun and engaging.
I absolutely loved the dancing component.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The virtual format was well adapted for COVID. We also had changes to film ourselves outside, which we all took advantage of.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, the course is super fun and not stressful!
Absolutely take this course if you have any interest in ballet.
I would recommend to anyone wanting to learn more about the ballet industry and arts generally. The atmosphere of the class is very inclusive and supportive.
Yes, absolutely! The experience of learning from one of the best dancers in the world and get the opportunity to speak with other incredible creatives.
Yes! I would definitely recommend this class to another student, especially if you have a personal connection with dance and the arts!
